business.headline: Switched jobs this year? Here's how to file your ITR rightIf you worked for more than one employer in the same year, make sure to report each salary and related deductions separately in the ITR form. Don't mix them up; each employer's income should be shown in its own section. This helps avoid overlaps and mistakes.

Where are India's ultra-rich families investing in 2025?A new EY–Julius Baer report, The Indian Family Office Playbook, reveals that many family offices are moving away from traditional wealth preservation and diving into global markets, private credit, and real assets.

Rs 45 lakh for raising a child? Why parenting feels like a luxury nowRising everyday expenses, pricey education and costly healthcare are forcing many young couples to think twice about kids. According to a startup founder, starting a family is personal, but money has become a key factor.

Madras High Court backs bank appointment cancellation over adverse CIBIL reportThe Madras High Court upheld SBI's decision to cancel a candidate's appointment due to adverse credit history, stressing that financial discipline is essential for roles involving public money.

No guarantees in mutual funds: Investment adviser warns against risky PF adviceAn investment adviser explains why PF money should not be used for risky bets like mutual funds with "guaranteed returns."

Why saving 30% of your income isn't always possible, CA explainsFor those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, explains CA Abhishek Walia. For those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, he says.

Will Sensex and Nifty hit record highs in July? Here's all you need to knowWith domestic flows steady and global risks fading, July could be the moment markets break through resistance. But with key events ahead, will momentum hold or falter?

JSW Paints to acquire majority stake in Akzo Nobel IndiaWith this move, JSW Paints will take sole control of Akzo Nobel India, which operates under the Dulux brand, and emerge as the fourth-largest player in the decorative paints segment.

Sensex, Nifty open higher for 4th straight session as global cues aid momentumThe BSE Sensex opened with a gain of over 140 points and was trading 89.06 points higher at 83,844.93 around 9:22 am. The NSE Nifty50 breached the 25,600-mark at the open before paring some gains to trade 25.35 points up at 25,574.35.

Once-dominant online job boards CareerBuilder, Monster go bankruptCreated through the September merger of CareerBuilder and Monster, the Chicago-based company said it agreed to sell its job board operations, its most recognisable business, to JobGet, which has an app for so-called gig workers.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Penalties, missed refunds and what to do nextWhether you're a salaried professional, freelancer, or a business owner, choosing the right ITR (Income Tax Return) form is important. Getting it wrong might mean missed refunds, penalties, or worse, your return being treated as invalid.

Sensex ends 1,000 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,000.36 points to end at 83,755.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 304.25 points to close at 25,549.00.

From phones to partners: 8 money lessons to learn before 30Managing money isn't just about making budgets, it's about making better choices, every single day. CA Nitin Kaushik shares eight crucial money lessons that everyone should grasp by the age of 30.

Are your savings at risk? Government may slash PPF, NSC rates next weekSo far this year, interest rates for schemes such as Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), Senior Citizens Savings Scheme (SCSS), and Post Office term deposits have remained unchanged. However, this may not continue in the next quarter.

Housing sales drop 20% across top 7 cities in Q2 2025 as prices stay highA sluggish Q2 masked early signs of recovery in India's housing market, with rising prices, cautious buyers, and skewed supply dampening sales—but softening rates and easing tensions may turn the tide.

Hiding income or making wrong claims? Your ITR could attract a 200% penaltyThe recent changes in Income Tax Return (ITR) regulations highlight stricter penalties for incorrect filings, including a potential 200% penalty on false claims.

Roti, kapda, but no makaan? The disappearing dream of affordable housingAffordable housing is vanishing from India's cities, and the crisis runs deeper than shrinking supply. In this deep dive, we explore how rising costs, fading supply, and policy gaps are shutting the door on millions chasing the ownership dream.

How expensive a house should you buy? Investment banker shares these 6 rulesAn investment banker lays down six clear, conservative rules for home buying to help first-time buyers avoid the trap of overleveraged homeownership.

Received Form 16? Don't file your ITR without checking these pointsForm 16 is a certificate your employer gives you every year. It shows how much salary you earned in the financial year and how much tax was deducted from it. This tax is called TDS (Tax Deducted at Source).

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft as world's most valuable company after 4% surgeNvidia's shares touched a new record high of $154.10, after climbing 4.33% during the trading session. This rally followed a positive report from Loop Capital, which raised its price target for Nvidia from $175 to $250.

Sensex rises over 500 points, crosses 83,000: Why is stock market rising today?By 9:59 am, the Sensex had gained 549 points to touch 83,305.06, while the Nifty rose by 172.75 points to 25,417.50. The mood across the broader market was upbeat, and volatility remained surprisingly muted.

US Bitcoin Reserve signals a shift: An opening for IndiaIndia stands at a pivotal juncture. A measured Bitcoin strategy—perhaps a reserve pilot—could strengthen economic resilience and project modernity. As the US advances and nations like Bhutan adapt, India has a unique opportunity to lead.
Sensex opens 127 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; Eternal gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 364.24 points to 83,119.75, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.95 points to 25,359.70 as of 9:31 am.

Sebi penalises BSE Rs 25 lakh for unequal data access, failure in oversightSebi called the failure by BSE 'laxity and negligence' and pointed out that BSE, being a first-level regulator, has a duty to maintain a clean and fair trading environment.

Sensex, Nifty opening on June 26: Will stock market rise again today?As of 8:24 am, the Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,287 points. This suggests that the Nifty50 could open around its previous close of 25,244.75.

Stocks to watch on June 26: SBI, Tata Steel, One Mobikwik, Adani EnterprisesStrong global signals and a steady flow of news from domestic companies helped keep investor sentiment upbeat as Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session.
Adani Total Gas and Jio-bp partner to expand fuel access across IndiaThis collaboration will see Jio-bp's premium petrol and diesel sold at select Adani fuel outlets, according to ATGL's statement.
Sensex closes 700 points higher, Nifty above 25,200, Titan up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 700.40 points to end at 82,755.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 200.40 points to close at 25,244.75.

Jewellery vs gold ETFs: How to make make money shine, not just wrists, explains CAGold jewellery may look beautiful, but it often comes with hidden costs, resale hassles, and emotional attachment that cloud financial judgement.

Planning to buy a house? This is India's most affordable city in 2025A report from Knight Frank India's latest Affordability Index highlights that RBI's decision to cut the repo rate by 100 basis points since February 2025 has played a key role in improving housing affordability across the country.

Want SIP success? Do this every month, says stock market expertSIP calculators do a fine job of showing projections. However, they don't account for emotions, self-doubt, or the unpredictability of life, mentioned a stock market expert.
GST Council meeting: What to expect from upcoming meet?The previous GST Council meeting took place on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Since then, many matters have remained pending.

8 key documents you must keep ready before filing your ITR for FY 2024–25One of the first documents you'll need is Form 16, which your employer gives you. It shows your total salary, how much tax was deducted, and what deductions were claimed.

EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 722.55 points to 82,777.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 209.15 points to 25,253.50 as of 2:25 pm.

HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.
Sensex, Nifty rally continues for second day as geopolitical fears subsideThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 442.13 points to 82,497.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.10 points to 25,171.45 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to open higher? Check key trading levelsA fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel has helped calm investor nerves and improve market sentiment across Asia and other major regions.

Stocks to watch on June 25: Infosys, Union Bank, RITES, Aurobindo PharmaMarkets saw a volatile session on Tuesday as they tracked the developments in the Middle East. The benchmark indices showed sharp ups and downs before closing with small gains.

Why middle-class Indians prefer Dubai to India for buying property, explains CAIn Dubai, many middle-class Indian couples have managed to purchase two to three properties by saving meticulously over the years. These properties, which offer rental yields of 6–7%, are financed at an interest rate of just 5%, creating sustainable assets that serve as both income sources and retirement plans.

entertainment.headline: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey slams Ram Kapoor for offensive remarks, apologises to womenActor Sudhanshu Pandey has openly criticised Ram Kapoor's inappropriate comments made during the 'Mistry' promotional tour. He has also issued a sincere apology to women on behalf of the television industry, highlighting the need for respect and decency.

Maargan review: Vijay Antony's ambitious thriller lacks the punch it promisesReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025Maargan movie review: Director Leo John Paul's 'Maargan', starring Vijay Antony and Ajay Dhishan, is a convoluted mess of a crime thriller with high ambitions. With a crisp runtime, the whodunnit relies heavily on the twists and turns.

All you need to know about Squid Game 3: Release time, new cast, and what to expectThe thriller series 'Squid Game 3' has premiered globally on Netflix. The show is expected to release all six episodes at once. Here's all you should know about it before starting to binge-watch.

Squid Game 3 review: Lee Jung-jae's show is still deadly but less thrillingReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025'Squid Game 3' review: Lee Jung-jae's 'Squid Game Season 3' released on Netflix today, June 27. The gripping and well-crafted series has its own moments of falter.

Kannappa review: Prabhas shines in a legendary tale that misses its soulReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025Kannappa movie review: Starring Vishnu Manchu in the lead, along with extended cameos by Prabhas, Akshay Kumar and Mohanlal, this mythological film banks more on the devotion and star power of the cameos than screenplay, direction and execution.

Exclusive: Sonakshi Sinha highly recommends marriage, calls it fun and amazingActor Sonakshi Sinha shared a refreshing take on married life, dispelling myths that it brings drastic changes. In an exclusive interview with us, she emphasised that marriage is far from the negativity often portrayed.

When Sunjay Kapur's wife Priya talked about including Karisma Kapoor in familyThe late businessman Sunjay Kapur's wife Priya Sachdev spoke about her unusual family dynamics and equation with actor Karisma Kapoor in an earlier interview. She also talked about going on family holidays with her.

Alia Bhatt calls Rekha her ReMaa in heartfelt ode after Umrao Jaan screeningActor Alia Bhatt paid a heartfelt tribute to Rekha at the screening of 'Umrao Jaan' (1981). The former also shared a unique name for the veteran actor in her social media post.

F1 director shares Top Gun 3 update, calls it Tom Cruise's one last rideDirector Joseph Kosinski confirmed the development of 'Top Gun 3' with a fresh, deeper storyline. He revealed about exploring Maverick's existential crisis and promising one last ride on a much bigger scale.

Guru Randhawa deactivates X account hours after his indirect dig at Diljit DosanjhSinger Guru Randhawa deactivated his X account on Friday. The move came hours after he took an indirect dig at 'Sardaar Ji 3' actor Diljit Dosanjh for going ahead with the overseas release of the film starring Pakistani actor Hania Aamir.
Kannappa X review: Fans love Prabhas, praise the gripping second halfVishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' released in theatres on June 27. The film also stars Akshay Kumar, Mohanlal, and Prabhas in key roles.

Kareena gets real on parenting, says her boys fuss when she's at work, praises SaifKareena Kapoor opened up about the struggles of being a working mother and how Saif Ali Khan supports their children as a hands-on father. She spoke to Vicky Kaushal about the same.

Maa X reviews: Fans call Kajol's film average, praise her acting and VFXKajol's 'Maa', a mythological horror film, released in theatres today. The film received mixed reviews, with fans praising her acting and the VFX.

Pushpa girls Samantha, Sreeleela end rift rumours with warm hug at event. WatchActors Samantha and Sreeleela put speculations about their rift to rest in their latest public appearance together. Reports emerged in 2024 that claimed Sreeleela had replaced Samantha in a special dance number for 'Pushpa 2'.

Jeff Bezos Venice wedding: Kardashians, Leo DiCaprio, Orlando Bloom check inBillionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancee Lauren Sanchez have begun their lavish three-day wedding festivities in Venice. The Kardashian family, Oprah Winfrey, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Bill Gates, among other celebrities, got clicked as they joined the couple for the festivities.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 7: Aamir Khan's film wraps up a solid first week'Sitaare Zameen Par' will now face Kajol's 'Maa' at the box office. The latter could pose a challenge to the smooth run of Aamir Khan's film, given the extensive screen sharing at the box office.

Rashmika Mandanna looks unrecognisable in Mysaa, her fiercest film yetRashmika Mandanna announced her new film, titled 'Mysaa'. The first poster of the film featured her as a fierce warrior. More details about the film have been kept under wraps.

Actor Brad Pitt's home ransacked in Los Angeles, police investigate burglaryActor Brad Pitt's Los Feliz house was burgled while he was busy with the global promotional tour of his new sports action-drama 'F1'. This incident highlights a growing trend of burglaries in high-profile Los Angeles neighbourhoods.

Neeru Bajwa deletes Sardaar Ji 3 Instagram posts amid row over Diljit's filmAmid backlash for her upcoming film 'Sardaar Ji 3' with Diljit Dosanjh and Hania Aamir, Neeru Bajwa has deleted all her social media posts related to the film.

general news.headline: Student gangraped in Kolkata law college, Trinamool leader, 2 students arrestedA law college student in South Kolkata was allegedly gangraped inside the campus premises. Police have arrested three accused, including a former student and a staff member, in the case.

Kolkata law student spurned marriage proposal, gangraped inside guard room: PoliceA 24-year-old woman said that she was gangraped inside a South Kolkata law college by a former student and two current students after rejecting a marriage proposal from the main accused. She further stated that the accused filmed the assault, blackmailed her with the footage, and threatened to harm her and her family.

Urine and faeces on clothes, tied up, locked in rooms: Noida old age home horrorDuring the raid, a woman claiming to be a nurse was found, but investigation revealed she was only 12th-pass. Elderly residents were found in clothes soiled with urine and faeces.The residents were forced to care for themselves.

From Sharma to Shukla, night lights reveal India's transformation over the yearsIf Rakesh Sharma, the first Indian to fly to space in 1984, were to travel to space once again, the view of India's night-time lights would leave him transfixed. Night-time lights as seen from space indicate economic progress and urbanisation. This is how the look of India has changed from Sharma to Shubhanshu Shukla in 2025.

Politics and history of inclusion of 'socialist' and 'secular' in the PreambleThe terms were added during a period of quasi-dictatorship, when the government's word was the law. Critics argue they were imposed without proper debate.

India rejects UN help in Air India crash probe: ReportIndia declined a UN aviation investigator's offer to assist in the Air India crash probe that killed 274. Previously, the International Civil Aviation Organisation has deployed investigators to help with certain probe

Tow trolley, 40 staffers from UK as F-35 refuses to leave Kerala even after 13 daysBraving rain on Thiruvananthapuram airport's tarmac, the British $110-million stealth F-35B jet remains grounded in Kerala, now to be towed into a hangar for repairs. A special tow vehicle and 40 UK engineers are flying in to fix the hydraulic snag that's kept the F-35B earthbound since June 14.

$30 billion for civil nuclear programme: Report details US proposal for Iran dealAmerica is considering helping Iran access USD 30 billion to build a civilian-energy-producing nuclear programme, in a surprising twist in the diplomatic ties between the two nations, CNN reported.

Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

How a country that helped Israel get nuclear weapons junked its own nukesIsrael, the only undeclared nuclear power, started work on its N-weapons programme within years of the founding of the Jewish nation. One of its clandestine partners was apartheid-era South Africa. While Israel is said to be in possession of 90 warheads now, South Africa signed the NPT and junked its nukes.

Accident happened even at Kumbh: Jagan Reddy gets court relief in convoy deathWhile granting interim relief to former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy in the death of a party supporter, the High Court stated that accidents occurred even during the Kumbh Mela despite all precautions.

We take pride in being like our mothers, but some legacies need letting goFor most of us, the bond we share with our mothers is one of the most cherished. Perhaps that's why we tend to follow them so instinctively. But while their intentions are rarely harmful, many of the legacies they leave behind are unconsciously ingrained, and some of them, though well-meaning, need to be questioned and gently let go.

Video: Elephant loses control, triggers panic during Rath Yatra in AhmedabadDuring the 148th Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath in Ahmedabad, an elephant lost control in the Khadia area, causing panic. The animal lost balance but was soon brought under control with the help of doctors and the forest department. Prompt action by police to clear the area ensured no casualties occurred.

Maa review: Kajol salvages striking but familiar myth-meets-fantasy horrorReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025'Maa' movie review: 'Maa' features Kajol as a mother battling dark mythological forces in a visually rich horror setting. Despite impressive effects, the film struggles with predictable storytelling and emotional impact.

S Jaishankar's 'Kissa Kursi Ka' jibe at Congress over EmergencyExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday referenced the movie 'Kissa Kursi Ka', the Raj Babbar-Shabana Azmi starring movie that was banned from being released during 'Emergency', in taking a dig at the Congress.

Thin at what cost? The mental toll of the weight-loss raceThe quest for weight loss has taken a dramatic turn. A wave of new-age solutions, from once-weekly injectables like Wegovy and Mounjaro to oral GLP-1 drugs and off-label prescriptions, has flooded global markets, including India. But as our bodies shrink, our minds may be buckling under pressure…

India suggests 4-pronged plan to China to manage border tensions, better tiesDefence Minister Rajnath Singh suggested a four-point formula to his Chinese counterpart, Admiral Dong Jun, during a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) in Qingdao, China.

Caught on camera: Gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria's mother shot dead in PunjabThe attack occurred near a bakery on Kadian Road in Punjab, where unidentified assailants on a motorcycle opened fire on the Scorpio car.
Delhi swelters in unexpected humidity: Where are the monsoon rains?The humidity impedes the body's natural cooling through sweat evaporation, making conditions dangerously uncomfortable.

Kannappa review: Prabhas shines in a legendary tale that misses its soulReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025Kannappa movie review: Starring Vishnu Manchu in the lead, along with extended cameos by Prabhas, Akshay Kumar and Mohanlal, this mythological film banks more on the devotion and star power of the cameos than screenplay, direction and execution.

Trump says China trade deal done, hints at 'very big' trade agreement with IndiaUS President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with China on rare earths and hinted at a major upcoming deal with India, aiming to strengthen US global trade ties and supply chain stability.

Japan hangs 'Twitter killer' who lured, murdered nine in 1st execution since 2022Japan executed Takahiro Shiraishi, known as the "Twitter killer," for murdering nine people in 2017, marking the country's first execution in nearly three years.

Annamalai to get national role but continue work in Tamil Nadu: Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah revealed that former Tamil Nadu BJP state chief K Annamalai will be given national responsibilities, while playing key role in Tamil Nadu politics. Shah also asserted that the NDA will form the Tamil Nadu government in 2026.

sports.headline: West Indies cricketer accused of sexual assault, victims allege cover-up: ReportAt least eleven women, including a teenager, have accused a West Indies cricketer of sexual harassment. The player, who is from Guyana, is at the centre of allegations that local authorities have attempted to cover up, according to media reports.

ENG vs IND Women's ODI and T20I Live Streaming: All you need to knowEngland vs India Women's ODI, T2OI series 2025 Live Streaming: England will host the Indian women's team for five T20Is and three ODIs. With the ODI World Cup fast approaching, both teams will aim to put their best foot forward and fine-tune their combinations across the series.

India have to play Kuldeep Yadav to win in England: Michael ClarkeEngland vs India: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke has advised Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill to pick Kuldeep Yadav for the remaining Test matches, calling the decision an absolute 'no-brainer.'

India win first-ever Mixed Disability match at Lord's, beat hosts EnglandAfter losing the first two matches of the Mixed Disability T20I series, India bounced back to beat England in a historic occasion at Lord's on Wednesday. The fourth match of the seven-match series will be played on Friday.

Freestyle Chess Tour's India-leg cancelled due to lack of sponsorsThe Freestyle Chess Tour's fifth edition that was to be held in Delhi now stands cancelled due to the lack of interest from sponsors. Now the tournament will likely resume with the next edition in Las Vegas later next month.

Mbappe accuses PSG of 'moral harassment, files legal complaint vs ex-clubDespite having made the move to the club of his dreams, Real Madrid, Kylian Mbappe is still at odds with his former club, Paris Saint-Germain, with the French striker accusing the reigning Champions League winners of 'moral harassment'.

Avinash Sable eyes personal best and World Championship redemptionAvinash Sable has recovered from a year-long injury and is preparing for the World Athletics Championships. His focus is on improving his personal best and making a strong comeback on the global stage.

WI vs AUS: Coach Sammy meets referee Srinath over contentious TV umpiring decisionsWest Indies coach Darren Sammy spoke with match referee Javagal Srinath to express his apprehensions about Adrian Holdstock officiating in the ongoing Test series against Australia. The West Indies head coach had also raised similar concerns during the series against England.

No Williamson; Milne, Henry return as New Zealand announce tri-series squadNew Zealand have named Adam Milne and uncapped Bevon Jacobs in their T20I squad for next month's tri-series in Zimbabwe, but will be without Kane Williamson and Lockie Ferguson as new head coach Rob Walter begins preparations for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

European teams vs USA weather: FIFA Club World Cup is facing the heatSoaring heat and poor pitches at the 2025 Club World Cup in the U.S. left European teams struggling, raising serious concerns for FIFA ahead of next year's expanded World Cup across North America.

Club World Cup: Man City crush Juve in 5-2 win, Real Madrid down SalzburgManchester City ended their group stage with yet another emphatic win, picking up a 5-2 victory to secure their place in the knockout stages of the FIFA World Cup. Meanwhile, Real Madrid also put up a clinical display in their 3-0 win over RB Salzburg.

Avinash Sable eyes personal best and World Championship redemptionAvinash Sable has recovered from a year-long injury and is preparing for the World Athletics Championships. His focus is on improving his personal best and making a strong comeback on the global stage.

WI vs AUS: Coach Sammy meets referee Srinath over contentious TV umpiring decisionsWest Indies coach Darren Sammy spoke with match referee Javagal Srinath to express his apprehensions about Adrian Holdstock officiating in the ongoing Test series against Australia. The West Indies head coach had also raised similar concerns during the series against England.

No Williamson; Milne, Henry return as New Zealand announce tri-series squadNew Zealand have named Adam Milne and uncapped Bevon Jacobs in their T20I squad for next month's tri-series in Zimbabwe, but will be without Kane Williamson and Lockie Ferguson as new head coach Rob Walter begins preparations for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

European teams vs USA weather: FIFA Club World Cup is facing the heatSoaring heat and poor pitches at the 2025 Club World Cup in the U.S. left European teams struggling, raising serious concerns for FIFA ahead of next year's expanded World Cup across North America.

Club World Cup: Man City crush Juve in 5-2 win, Real Madrid down SalzburgManchester City ended their group stage with yet another emphatic win, picking up a 5-2 victory to secure their place in the knockout stages of the FIFA World Cup. Meanwhile, Real Madrid also put up a clinical display in their 3-0 win over RB Salzburg.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
